titleStmt.title: Huon d'Auvergne, Turin Biblioteca Nazionale Universitaria N III 19 (T) Annotations

div.note: 1] Also transcribed by Holtus (2001), pp. 48-50, lines 1-109; Pasinus, 1-10; Peyron 1-16; Graf (1878) 1-72.

4] Rajna here places a description of the miniature: Min. 1. un re (tutto army) e parecchie altre figure; non intendo bene l'imagin/ Yug. dirige un psonag/ porge un breve/ ad un altro ch 'è/ inginocchiato/ forse l'invito d'uon a corte
5] Numbers in Rajna's notebook are in pencil, added later.
7] Rajna: 2r. The manuscript began on a recto when he saw it, with 6 lines: 4 followed by a miniature, with two more following it. Here is the beginning of today's MS.
10] In Rajna's transcription, "y." somewhat after "el" above the line.
22] Rajna notes "sic" after vevole.
23] Holtus: los. "y" crossed out; Rajna: "caratt. più picc / forte aggiunte fatte / poi –i =" (marginal note).
45] Rajna, note in right margin (sic). B: Anchois le haete la giant d[e] la [con]trie. T seems to be missing the verb, "odia"; an emeded reading might be anzo li (odi)a la zente de la contrà.
63] Rajna note: "prima soa e così / parrebbe ancora / non credo si [tr?] /volz corregg".
66] Rajna reverses these two lines, and uses numbering in the left margin to make clear their order.
76] Cf. Crusca, al dilungo, vol. 1.
93] Rajna, note "no del solito inchiostro / più nero delle giunte." At the beginning of his transcription, Rajna comments more on the various details of handwriting than toward the end.
102] Rajna: seneschalcho, with the first "e" changed into "i" with a dot above and filled in.
109] End of Holtus (2001) transcription.
110] Rajna's notebook has "V" in the left margin, together with a crossed-out label, "IV."
120] Rajna omits this line and later inserts in the right margin, thus beginning the line numbers of his transcription being off from the total.

123] Rajna: messy note here, running over beginning of the following line: "O e in? / (non) mi pare" after having crossed out "Em?"; the "non" is written after, squeezed in; he clearly was not sure. The "E" covers the beginning of "Charlo" below.
124] This line omitted in Rajna initially, inserted in right margin according to signal similar to "F." MS: ācorte, at the beginning of the line.

125] prendea: the "e" is not clearly formed, missing the loop. However, here as elsewhere, if there is not a dot for the "i" I presume that it is an "e": thanks to M. Scattolini for this tip. In the right margin, Rajna has added a note, "I vari aggiunti nei margini sono stati saltati nella trascrizione frettolosa." Perhaps this explains the problem with this line: the king should have taken him by the hand, "prenduto" or something similar, and instead there are two verbs, "avè" and "prendea."

194] Rajna: zos, with a mark in the margin; note on left side, referring to that mark: "qui un (a) lett. cancellz/ e sopra scritto un e, a.i./ Si dice legittima, legg. zosa." He has an "a" crossed out in the right margin.
196] MS: baldovĩo; Rajna: baldovij, with a note in the left margin, "corr. in baldovĩo a.i."

199] It is difficult to make sense of this line; I'm interpreting "each of them knocked his own down thoroughly," which requires understanding "le sovo" for MS: le sono (the parenthesis are for the emendation). However "n" and "v" are frequently difficult to distinguish; cf. Holtus 1985, p. XXXV.
206] Rajna initially misses this line and inserts it afterward in the margin.

219] There are a couple of ways that this could be interpreted: first, "le roi... / armé, et avec toutes ses armes décorées d'une fleur de lys"; or, "[the king] is armed in weapons all decorated with a fleur-de-lys"; that is, the second word of the line could be a verb or the conjunction.

221] elziso: this form seems to be from alzire/elzire; cf. Aquilon de Bavière, "to kill"; the line then means, "that is, Huon, who wouldn't have killed him [Berardo] at all." Compare to B, where the verb is "to hate."
240] This line does not make sense, since the copyist didn't understand the type of horse, "amoravis" and changed the term to something he knew! Compare with B.
243] Rajna's copy shows a spot above "quelo," but it does not seem to be a dot to an "i" merely an imperfection in the paper.

246] Illumination follows: Rajna, "2 giostra." In fact there is a view of one horsed man from the front, with a crown on his head and a sun on his chest in the center of the page; behind, to the right, there is a side view of a figure in grey on horseback with his lance at the attack position, with the same sun motif on the horse's caparison and a cape visible on his back.
263] Rajna initially omits this line and adds it in the margin afterwards.
302] B: selong lor coi[n]tenance. Nowhere else in this MS does any such form "sealonga" appear.
306] Rajna initially skips this line and adds it later in the left margin.
313] Rajna note: "li lom o loim, non /loin; ma / il segno sopra non / è un i troppo/ legittimo, ma rro/ poi (mi pare) un segno / p l'asta sotta / posta – se è / fu mal fatto."
330] Rajna, note in margin: (sir, voglio)
356] "a dove a dove"= a due a due; cf. "sove" = sue
363] This line and the following are initially incorrectly ordered in Rajna, who then writes numbers in the left margin to indicate the correct order.
380] sorprisse: there is a dot above the second "r," not above the following vowel.
413] Rajna notes that he is not sure whether the MS reads "in" or "m." The strokes are linked.
417] Illumination: two men under tree, one with horns and bells, the other with hat over his eyes.
418] The MS has been scratched: ve:y is what the MS looks like. B: Quant vos forma (l. 421)
436] Rajna has a mark after "chy" and before "ßve" that is unclear; it looks like a little caret. Perhaps this should read "ss[er]ve"?
438] Rajna omits the "o" of "yo."
440] There seems to be a line missing here; cf. B 444: Non ai ge soingn fors tout soul de celli (between this line and the following).
443] Rajna omits the "u" of "nuy." These two omissions make one wonder about the "y" in line 444—should it be "yo"?
458] MS: chre da more in B reads qui n'iert d'amore
459] Rajna transcribes in reverse order this and the following line; he numbers in left margin to indicate the need to reorder.
463] Rajna: ne piga. He underlines the word and has a line under the "p"; would seem to have been uncertain himself of the reading. B: emplie.
476] Cf. Dante and the pilgrim's expressions of shame: e.g., Inf. 17.85-90.
478] For "se tene y[n]tra ello" B: si tient traïe
484] After the second "pensery," Rajna notes (sic).
485] Rajna: anyda parla
514] Rajna initially omits this line, then inserts it in the left margin.
520] Rajna has a number of marks above this line that appear to be abbreviations: "razŷ...tōrmenta."
525] Rajna initially omits this line, then inserts it in the left margin.
544] B 549: Ja estes sire, et tot a vos atent
569] The second half of this line is problematic; the hemistich reads in B: "Oïl, mon bon segnor."

623] savye: where the ink is worn, it is frequently difficult to see the tail below the line; this could well read savie. However, under the light the tail can be seen. Here the tail is only visible with the ultraviolet light.
624] Rajna reverses this line and the following, noting the correct order in the left margin.
652] Rajna reads "guer" but the MS clearly reads a sapiate just at the edge of the burned portion.
669] Rajna reads "guer" but the MS clearly reads a sapiate just at the edge of the burned portion.
670] Illumination follows (Rajna: "4 Fig (Carlo e Sandino)
680] Rajna, marginal note: "e dei corr. Sng."; this last must be an abbreviation.
686] "Si non, défiez le..." (Literally, "Cela si il se trouve [si il est] que non)"
714] Rajna omits initially and then inserts in the left margin.
729] Rajna reverses this line and the following, and indicates the correct order by numbering in the left margin.

750] End of the first fascicle of Rajna's notebook. Second begins with next line, "Tor. 2." in upper corner, with "13" in red underneath. From here on, there are only numbers in red in the upper right corner of each opening, not sequential numbers as in the first fascicle.

758] viva: these last four letters are distinctly different from the other strokes around them. They are smaller, and written above the bottom line of the rest of the verse. Added afterwards, with a different pen? Perhaps originally the end read "li à"?

762] Before "aƣpir" there is a little stroke above the line. However, since there is no caret or other mark to indicate insertion, I do not include it in the text. Rajna: apreso; MS clear has "apresso."

786] Illumination follows this line. Huon is kneeling before a double-crowned figure on a what seems to be a tiled floor (alternating dark and light), looking at a book that figure is holding open. Other figures are visible to the right, and one stands on the side of Huon, a little to our left looking at a book. Rajna leaves a bit of a blank but does not summarize the illumination as he does for later folios.

799] ee B 804-805: "Sens, abstinance, proece, tot ingual / In vos habite et ont pris son hostal." The Turin version is missing a line, "Intelligence, abstinence, ability, all equally..." or something similar, before this line.
809] Rajna reverses this and the next line, and numbers in the left margin to indicate the correct order.
818] pi(ù): blot on page at this point: cannot read the letter underneath
820] Scattolini notes that vv. 820-821 are reversed in order in comparison with B, creating difficulties in meaning.
823] Rajna notes "altro inch[iostro]/.d. /e mano"; the remaining MS text does not show notable differences, so he must be referring to the initial. The reference for the ".d." is unclear.
825] Rajna initially omits this line, then inserts it in the left margin.
844] The capital is like a "G" in capital form in Rajna.

854] Rajna has a large ink blot at the beginning of (his) 845-46 that blocks part of the reading, and at the end of his 846, has some difficulties: unclear if "fassemo" and then corrects to "demora" (the "o" has been changed and reinforced).
856] MS: "t(r) a" crossed out after zuro
863] Before che: crossed out word
864] ell'era = "ello era"
913] Rajna omits this line initially and inserts it later in the right margin.

942] Illumination follows this line. Much of the color is gone: to the far right a ruler under a baldicchino throne wearing a hat with two levels (the upper recessed in relation to the lower) sits while a male figure in parti-colored tights to the viewer's left with his back to the reader holds something in his arms; another figure further to the reader's left is partially visible.
964] Rajna: piuue? piude? piuie? B: cu[n] estre puisent plu. The final strokes of Rajna's handwritten copy are not clear.
973] MS: fustue?

982] Illumination follows. Rajna: "Figura. "La e più bella d'ussai fin qui trovata è doppia con una sola scena / a destra il palazzo con due torri, dall'usero si vede nel portony Ugo/ benedire le vivande della tavola a cui siede il pilgri_ a sinistra/ si vede in alto un diavolo che vola colla tavola, e sotto fuori dall'uscio/ Ugo e altri che guardon su con atti di meraviglia _ una donna sta / meraviglij o piuttosto atterita a una finestra _ c'è espressione
992] Rajna seems to have "lafu" crossed out before the final "lafu," whether correcting his own error or one of the MS is unclear.
1040] Rajna: per has a dot above the "r" but this appears to be an imperfection of the paper.
1053] Here Graf transcribes 5 lines. Rajna: "lo @te" crossed out after "Quando."
1062] MS: grand; Rajna: grand; there is a final something below the line: "o"? B: brand da galons, which makes much more sense.

1083] Nil temere uxori de servis crede querenti :/ Semper enim mulier quem coniux diligit odit./ Catonis Disticha, I, 8 (Éd. E. Baehrens, Poetae latini minores, III, Leipzig, Teubner, 1881). / « Ne crois pas à la légère une épouse qui se plaint de tes esclaves, car une femme déteste toujours celui que son mari apprécie ».
1084] After "lasa", scratched out "le".
1086] Rajna: cħ (in the margin) ᵱocho (chy) non li feze; Rajna note: "scritt. orig/ tutto correz." B: A pués qu'il non li a feit. My emendation for sense.
1088] Rajna: si, "s" written over "l."

1103] MS: aldare. The second letter is an odd combination, a long stroke with a small cross at the "t" level that curves slightly to the right, but not enough to be an "s"; there is not a separated dot so Rajna's "i" does not seem likely.
1124] Illumination follows: Ugon standing by box? bed? with black figure flat. (Rajna: "Ug s'arma al letto della moglie addormenty.")
1135] cobia = "commiato"; cf. B, congieç.
1152] Rajna: choro. MS reading is clear, however, there is no "h".
1162] Graf transcribes five lines beginning here.
1171] Graf: m[i]o, emendation.
1181] Graf omits ll. 1185-1187; Rajna includes them.
1185] Rajna omits this line initially, then inserts in the right margin.
1236] Rajna note, "corr. da smary; st. / mano" = stesso mano (same hand).
1242] Rajna note, "corr./ da schiary/ st. mano" = stesso mano (same hand).
1245] Rajna note, "corr. da desparty/ st. mano" = stesso mano (same hand).

1249] Rajna note, "corr. da monte / st. m." The structure here is not totally clear: since the third person plural is rare, should this be "montò-ne" for something like "mounted on them," or is it indeed third person plural?

1264] Illumination follows: an encircled area (paddock?) and a house with what seems to be a straw roof; a stands man in the entry and the head and neck of the horse in front of him (to the reader's right) with an armed man riding it, just visible before the burned section. Rajna: "U arriva alla casa del borghese".
1267] Rajna: giesie.
1272] Rajna initially omits this line and adds it afterward in the left margin.
1274] Apostolo: the Pope. Cf. B and other Franco-Italian Apostoille.
1276] The rest of the folio is blank. There is part of the catchword at the bottom of the page, "denan". Rajna also notes the space: "nuovo quad: iniz più grande tracij?/ in lapis"

1283] Rajna seems to have been having difficulties with his pen / ink here; he has a large "D" here at the beginning of this line; or perhaps he is seeking to show the larger "D" as mentioned in his note.

1286] Rajna: ī ? There is no dot on the the letter, so I have transcribed as an "e" though there is no circle around either. Illumination follows: Huon on his knees before the Pope in a very elaborate room with a coffered ceiling. Rajna, "Ug (piviro) ai piedi di un papa gig. Le iniz. sequit a ess transcritte in qto quaderno e manteng spesso la st. grandezza /le segnorò maiuscole."
1289] Graf transcribes 11 lines from here. Note that here the new folio in B (F 10) coincides with Turin's new folio.
1291] Rajna notes, "copto / da una / carta / infra..y". Nothing is now visible before line 1297.
1296] B: nue home si bien non.
1300] The trascriber had not understood here: it's an impossible thing, not not impossible!
1308] MS: dezo nona ho; Rajna: dezo nona homo; B: qu'il non se feit adon, "that this not be done now."
1310] Rajna: homo with the "h" crossed through.
1312] Rajna initially omits this line and inserts later in the left margin.
1314] The end of Rajna's line in undeciphrable here; however, since "sabione" appears four times and there are no other expressions beginning with "sab" this seems most logical.
1341] MS: space between "crosse" and "che": word scraped out? Nothing visible.
1343] Rajna: corr. da sigre?
1345] Rajna initially omits and then inserts in left margin.
4161] MS: quelo is followed by a blot before chel
4163] B: Fratres i[n] unu[m] avoir lor habitoire: the Latin quote present in the Berlin MS is not present here
4195] MS: nī
4197 MS: dne et ȳ with a line drawn through "et y".

4213] Rajna: the final word is unclear; the two vowels are clearly o, but the third consonant in particular is difficult to discern, perhaps -r-? Since the equivalent B line ends in sono, I have extrapolated here.
4218] For initial "M", see v. Rajna 4145, "Memento", here v. 4529.
4228] legione; cf. B4270: region.
4326] MS: predemo
4247] MS, Rajna: lirerespond e possibly a distraction by the following line, emended?
4254] B: por la soe lés; there is a reference to God's law. Here, however, it would seem that "la soa" refers to the faith and the syntax is reconstrued.
4270] MS: de avite tanto de podere; B: Qui ot ce fait, qui ot tant deponés
4284] vostra: Rajna, "e corr. da a, / se non erro". It is difficult to tell which letter is intended here.
4301] Rajna: repenteate ? the antepenultimate letter difficult to distinguish. “repentente,” ‘repenting’ would make little sense here.
4306] Rajna writes (sic) in the margin after this line and also in the following after poy.
4307] Rajna: poy (sic)
4322] MS: no verb; B: Le mercheant dit

4324] MS: S'ele el fato; Rajna: Sele elfato (he underlines where there is a problem with a section). Cf. B 4367: Si il ne·l feit, por autruy ne·l spereç [If he doesn’t do it, don’t hope for it from anyone else]
4328] Rajna marks this line with a cross in the right margin.
4329] Rajna: "e fuori" written in margin before his "4310" label.
4334] biava: MSI ‘biada’, perhaps because of intervocalic lenition and the difficulty of representing đ.
4339] The following line in B, 4384, reads: Vegant la grant manentie qu’ot aseç [Because of their rich cargo, of which they had so much]

4343] canta: Difficult to explain for the sense. Perhaps related to "incantare", to auction? Various figurative meanings are also attested; GDLI Vol. II, "9. Attestare, far fede [...] avere significato evidente"(p. 651); "17. Figur. Dire con forza, esprimere in modo chiaro ed energico; proclamare apertamente, con decisione, affermare in modo risoluto"(p. 652).
4351] disviluppare: sciogliere, slegare, snodare, dipanare; districare (GDLI vol IV, p. 841, col. 1).
4355]The initial letter of this line is peculiar, not the normal initial "m"- though three forms of maie appear (ll. 510, 512, 10073) here it seems rather to be an n.
4359] Cf. B 4405: Tot deust estre riche qi en cestuy reg(n)[e] sta
4360] MS: fano with a second "fano" crossed out after it
4369] Meregazzi: arivà, and all finals in this laisse -à. Meregazzi’s “Episodio” begins here, p. 13, and continues on odd-numbered pages in her article.
4378] MS: el vede chel cantar (with "chel" crossed out); Meregazzi: vedi…de là; note: correction of vede in vedi
4379] MS: et re y. (rest of the line is gone); Rajna: re underlined; in the left margin, “corr. da .y”
4384] Meregazzi: lesà
4387] Meregazzi: d’entorno
4390] MS: ac; Rajna: acor; blank space below. Rajna also writes, "Spazio". Meregazzi: vescove… areceveschove ... a cor
4391] Meregazzi: chi
4397] Meregazzi: dareto
4398] Meregazzi: me voy che site
4401] Meregazzi: signore
4405] The abbreviation line for the "n" is of y[n] is missing. Meregazzi: Me… yn
4407] andocha = B adon; I’m understanding it as “adoncha,” like OF “adonc,” ‘alors’; Meregazzi: ando[n]cha
4409] Meregazzi: yn doso
4418] Meregazzi: quisti

4420] MS, Rajna: responde; Meregazzi: (?) at the end of the line. B 4467: Le prest d’arme de Deu despoille et repon [The priest took off and put away God’s vestments]; “arme,” ‘arms’, understood as vestments.
4423] Meregazzi: tidesco

4425] MS, Rajna: andate antrare; Meregazzi: andate (entrare), dize (with a question mark at the end of the line); B 4472: A le autre dit, qe en la glisse son: / “Isseç dehors; cist veut confesion.” [ He said to the others who were in the church, / “Go outside; this man wants to make confession”]
4426] Meregazzi: vuol
4428] Meregazzi: intende
4431] Meregazzi: Ve conseiaremo
4432] Meregazzi: A lagremare ed a plurare
4437] No indent or any sign of new laisse in MS.
4438] Meregazzi: in zorno
4439] Meregazzi: pechador non
4441] Meregazzi: de per tanto
4444] Rajna: ata solvo, with "ata" in the left margin by the line number count.
4445] Meregazzi: segnà
4447] Meregazzi: e com
4448] Meregazzi: Meregazzi: dilo… dime (no further comments on her usage of writing together object pronouns with imperatives)
4449] Meregazzi: MS: liquesta. "l'i[n]questa" may have been intended and would be a possible emendation; Meregazzi: l’inquesta
4450] Meregazzi: sen vene, as always
4453] Rajna: che lolde
4454] Meregazzi: vivent
4462] Alternate interpretation: dize, “el to afare…
4467] MS: e scratched out before danata, where sera is written above the line. Rajna: si è raschiato e (for "danata")
4468] Meregazzi: se tristo

4472] Rajna has difficulty with this line; in the right margin, he notes "uman non viv*"(?); Meregazzi: […] ch’el non vite omo vivan, with a note “ms. vive… vivan per vite… vivan”; Cf. B 5420: Tiel çonse voy en vos qe non vi en hom human [I see such things in you that I have never seen in any earthly man]; The verb in the second hemistich seems to be a frequentative, formed on the past participle, so a unique form of “to see”.
4474] Rajna: (croce camelly?), in the margin. There is also a mark, | |
4478] Meregazzi: lazate
4479] Note Rajna's error in numbering.

4480] Note the error in sense: a non has been added somewhere along the line, to make the line say the opposite of what was intended in B, saying, "This isn't impossible" which makes no sense unless it refers to God’s assistance in the task. Cf. B, "Ce ert inposible dou tot a hom te[r]ran" (line 4528).
4482] Meregazzi: dize; she emends from MS dizo
4485] MS: prendrite followed by a crossed out l before the “un,” it appears. The page is torn closely here.
4487] Rajna: in the upper left hand corner of this page (his 69V, left of 70 in the microfilm) seems to be written "Nulla / ho omesso"; Meregazzi: poco
4489] Meregazzi: vede grande. B 4536: Part n’ay veue, greignor non vi vorman [Part of which I’ve seen, I’ve truly never seen greater]
4493] Meregazzi: li più
4495] Meregazzi: feramente
4496] Meregazzi: za; she only uses the accent for the equivalent of “già”; see also below, 4503, etc.
4497] Meregazzi: qui

4499] MS: vetuuoso has a line through the second stroke of the “v”; Meregazzi: ell’è de … fede (el è) veretuuoso; B 4547: Hom est de foy et tot le vertuç ha [He’s a man of faith and has all the virtues]. Here the second hemistich is interpreted as “in everything he is virtuous, and he remains so [i.e., virtuous].”
4500] mante = mante[n]
4501] Meregazzi: ynzenochià, as usual for final verbal -a endings in rhyme; cf. 4502, 4505, 4507, 4508, 4509, 4510, 4511, 4512, 4513, 4514, 4515, 4518, 4521,4522, 4523.
4504] Meregazzi: a my
4506] Cf. B, n'atent tant già (l. 4554)[it’s not fitting]. Meregazzi : non sa per tenereza
4507] Meregazzi: per tanto
4508] Meregazzi: porteno
4510] Meregazzi: in su
4511] MS: te deum al with the “l” crossed out.
4513] Meregazzi: me (as always for MSI ma, MSF mais); cf. 4519
4515] B: Qua[n]t l'eve fu cornée, chascun si soy lava (l. 4563); Meregazzi : Quando (levo) era …
4516] The initial two letters of this line are in the left margin.
4521] Meregazzi: a fora
4525] Between presto and sevole, crossed out letter y. Not noted by Rajna. Meregazzi: de là.
4526] Meregazzi: lielamente

4529] MS: despone laventura despone; Meregazzi: (despone) l’aventure; Rajna to right (si è). B 4578: Puis a lor bernage l’aventure despons [Then he recounted Huon’s undertaking to his assembled barons]
4534] For this line and the following, Rajna has switched the second hemistiches; he circles them and indicates with arrows that they are to be switched, writing "errore mio" beside the lines.
4539] Meregazzi: quy
4541] Meregazzi: pó
4544] MS: yano dito; Rajna: Yano dito; Meregazzi: i ano
4546] Meregazzi: questo faroy
4547] Cf. B 4598: Et il, a tant, le paroil leise a pont [And he, meanwhile, ceased speaking at that point]
4549] molte: the spot was scraped and the word written over it; the ink is slightly smeared. Rajna note in right margin: corr. si. che? (for "romanire molte")
Cf. B 4611: Aseç gi ot princeps, duch et contor [There was a fair number of princes, dukes and counts]
4563] B 4614: Oit .vii.c. mille jusquemant en la Sor [He had seven hundred thousand [men] as far as Syria]

4564] 4564] This line is in the right margin of the MS; it is not clear how it relates. Should it be only the end of one line? But cf. B 4615, quite long: Zascun ert a son mestier quant ert en ceste cor […]. B 4614-4618 are equivalent to lines 4563-66 here, but in a slightly different order. I follow Rajna in placing it on its own line. He notes, "in marg; è verso incompiuto; il richia/mo è dopo conte."
4565] MS (Rajna): parlate
4566] Meregazzi: qui
4567] Rajna: a no mé; Meregazzi: l’uno a nome haine; B 4619: "Le un n'ait hayne a l'autre, ainç s'aime p[er] amor"; the scribe here seems to have transposed letters in the initial hemistich.
4568] Rajna underlines the final vowel of "Tuti" and of servene; in a note at the end of the line "da legg o?"
4571] Meregazzi: et a plurare
4572] Meregazzi: yn versso
4577] Rajna: nel nel,with note in the right margin, (gi???)
4580] Rajna, note in right margin: (qui è forse lecito / legg o) in reference to the first vowel in lo teneno. It is difficult to tell, since the form is compressed, whether it is e or o.
4582] Meregazzi: ym plurando
4583] MS: e soa nave Tadeus; Meregazzi: donata

4584] MS: bono nave; Rajna, note in left margin: "corr. da bona nave" with "bon nevo" underlined. The vowels are altered: the final of "bon" is scraped off, with just a bit of ink visible; the other two are oddly formed, and the final letter is followed by a stroke that is not scraped off, leaving the intention unclear though the cross-stroke for the "e" is clear. MS: avuy, with the “v” written above the line.
4585] Meregazzi: e tuto

4586] Rajna transcribes this line and the following out of order, and numbers them in the left margin to indicate correct order. He does not note the abbreviation on "comada" that is clearly visible in the MS; he does note (in marg) at the end of the line beginning fately. Since the inserted line, written over two lines, is in the left margin, on the verso, the left side is burned, and only two bits (the ends of each half line) remain.
4588] a Dio: perhaps “adio”? I follow previous Rajna and Meregazzi with their division, though it is written as together in the MS.
4589] Meregazzi: a topianando
4590] Meregazzi: à zò che… fina VII
4592] Meregazzi: a zò che
4593] Meregazzi: vivente
4594] Meregazzi: a tanto
4595] Meregazzi: ym presente
4599] Meregazzi: ym presente
4600] MS: bescota? The final vowel has a thick outside stroke.
4601] Rajna: corr.; da che?
4601] MS: fono (s/f confusion is a frequent scribal error)
4604] B 4655: Tot le livrast s’il fust son plaquimant [They would deliver it all if it were his pleasure]. Perhaps a missing abbreviation for ‘r’?
4608] Meregazzi: davanti
4613] End of the first section of Meregazzi’s transcription, p. 31 (her line 4494).
4617] Rajna: lunta = "ontano"

4618] B 4669: Pues qe Karllon oit por spion eu [As soon as Charles had heard from his spy]; there is clearly a verb missing in this line in T. There is also a mix from the following line ending; here is a translation of it at the end of this line. Stengel’s edition “Eine weitere Textstelle aus der franco-venezianischen Chanson de geste von Huon d’Auvergne,” begins here.
4620] Stengel 4671. The further line numbering from Stengel will be omitted from here on.
4622] Rajna: elo el einsto; marginal note, l[ire]. insto
4633] Does non = "noi ne"—lei non sarà pronta [for it]?
4634] There is no sign of this being a new laisse in Rajna, and the left margin is gone from the MS. The division is made based on B.
4640] Stengel: ch’a el zifo
5653] Stengel: El befon
4661] As Rajna notes, there are lines around "lo re": |lore|; Rajna also has a dotted link between mete and mento.
4667] Rajna, Stengel: retenimento
4668] Stengel: ela wa fortefichando
4669] On visible abstractions, cf. Pulci; Morgante, “io vedevo la fame / in aria come un nugol d' acqua pregno” (Canto 18.196, 1-2).
4670] MS: li fa li fa oltrazo
4672] Rajna: Carlone with a note "agg." [added] in the right margin; Stengel: Carlon
4673] Stengel: yntrono
4674] MS, Rajna: tato; Stengel: ta[n]to
4676] This line and the following are reversed by Rajna, who then uses numbering in the left margin to clarify the order according to his usual system.
4679] MS: the initial p has a slash through the descender; it looks like a p with a c nested between the descender and the circle, with a slash below descending to the right.
4683] MS: after era, scratchout. A name seems to be missing here: Morando would be logical, since Rivera was his land and he is another of Ugon’s men. Stengel: Che y revera era […]
Rajna, note: "lett. corr. o / a o e; par / abbia da legg. / a"
4691] MS, Rajna: cete with r above the line, inserted.
4692] Stengel: dona, d’amore
4696] Catchword: retornato, that does not correspond to the following folio. Further proof that this section of the story is problematic; cf. B’s inserted signature.
4708] Rajna miscopies the second hemistich from the following line and then copies the second hemistich of this line in the following, drawing lines to indicate their correct collocation.
4715] Rajna notes: in the left margin, "(Err.)"; in the right margin, "g. o forse correz. dello/ st. mano, poi/ pero, ricalcata" ("diroy")
4719] End of fascicule 6, Rajna's transcription of Torino manuscript.

4720] Beginning of fascicule 7, Rajna's transcription of Torino manuscript; top right hand corner, "Tor. 7"; below in red ink, "73". Top left: "(Nulla omesso)" Our emendation based upon B 4719: “Moi proioit che sa dame por moy fust mantenus” [begged me to care for his lady].
4721] B 4720: N’en voil estre blasmés por hon chi soit viscus [I don’t wish to be blamed concerning this by any living man].

4722] d’avere pur… The reading of the second word in Rajna is difficult. The final -r is clear in the MS. B 4721: D’envoier por la dame quant il v’oit plaus [By sending for the lady as soon as it pleases you].
4725] an(o): the final letter is very faded and difficult to distinguish; Rajna: "l'o fu cancelly/ raschiat/ doveva probabilm/ cancellsi/ anche / l'a"

4726] On this line and its various versions in Huon d’Auvergne manuscripts, see S. P. McCormick, “‘Como fa la foja’: Versions of Female Authority in the Huon d’Auvergne Manuscript Tradition.” Italian Studies 70.1 (2015): 33-52.
4742] Only two forms with –np- appear, all twenty others are with –mp-.

4745] MS: Servire debe; there is a grammatical problem here. B 4745: Bem doit servir Tholomé chascuns, grant et menor [Everyone great and small must serve [such a] Ptolemy well]. There too is a problem, with “Tholomé”; see note in that edition for a possible explanation.
4749] Rajna: Co[m]biato
4751] MS: arcevecovo with “s” inserted; [con]seio with what appears to be “io” written above; Rajna: malvase
4752] Note that the next section differs from the B version; the equivalent of laisse 181 picks up in 4754 below, and more exactly divisions will pick up again at laisse 190.
4753] Rajna: da che quela dona tropo la sono la seno asentita; note in margin: “corr. da chi?” [corrected by whom?]
4754] This is approximately B 4773 ff.

4755] Rajna notes "Sopra di scrittura relativam[ente]/ recente con piu. co". The “co” is indeed above the MS yrona. An illumination follows. Rajna describes: "Il re dà la corona, [...] corona / e non so che altri anrnesi ai messi già a cavallo." Four figures on horseback, including one from the rear.
5763] The second section of Meregazzi, "Prete Gianni," begins here, her p. 31.
5767] Rajna: ɔpagnia; Meregazzi: ... dize, "e la ...
5770] Meregazzi: yn verso
5771] Meregazzi: ynlasaria; there are no other forms with this prefix. It seems to be a combination of “lassare” and “s’en aller”.
5773] Rajna: vustate? "a" written over "t"? Meregazzi: vusate
5777] Meregazzi: non per tanto
5778] Meregazzi: diaulo
5779] Meregazzi, p. 33. B6084: Se plus vesquisse qe non fist Jeremie [Even if I live as long as Jeremiah]
5784] B 6089: Je vos merci de la grant cortesie [I thank you for the great courtesy]; “mercier” not understood.
5786] Under “chavalo de la” is a scraped section with the current reading written over it.
5789] Meregazzi Laisse XIII.
5790] Meregazzi: chavalieri
5793] Meregazzi: omo
5795] Meregazzi: o non g’andò zamai
5796] Rajna: lo ɔte lo ɔte (sic)
5797] Meregazzi notes, “corr. vado in omo”- suggesting an emendation?
5798] Meregazzi: vui

5805] Rajna: lasassi; Meregazzi: de presio in the right margin, underlined, possibly a comment on the same word appearing at the end of the following line. However, line B 6111-12 also have the same concluding word, “pris”.
5806] Meregazzi, p. 35
5808] Meregazzi: pregeroy

5809] MS: che y[n] ne landare vuy… .Cf. B 6115: Que ambdos vos gart que non soieç oncis [That they both keep you from being killed]; Meregazzi: che yn ne l’andare [that in the going/on the trip?] It’s not clear though in that construction what the role of the “ne” is; perhaps “ynn el andare”?
5811] MS: lo core li presse; Meregazzi: me presse; B 6117: De pieté m’ais tant le cors espris [You have aroused such pity in my heart]; an “l” for an “s” is a possible scribal error.
5814] "che tu ne torni"; Meregazzi: retorny ancor (titulus not resolved)
5816] Meregazzi: sì yn sonto
5820] Meregazzi: volonterosso
5822] MS: auy y rende (final -e written over an -a); Meregazzi: Dio a vuy
5825] B 6132: Da toy si part li hom avenois [This {Alvernese}man is leaving you]

5828] Meregazzi: chi me lasse
5831] Rajna: marchese
5834] Meregazzi, p. 37
5835] Meregazzi: vaxalo… el
5836] Meregazzi: sen (as always; see also v. 5838 below)
5840] B 6147: Onque mes nef n’avoit tiel estormant [Never before had a ship had such a steersman]

5863] Meregazzi, p. 39
5871] Rajna: travaiante; MS: travaliante
5872] Meregazzi Laisse XV
5873] Rajna: possa dentro; the initial de is on a white spot of the MS, but does not appear to be crossed out.
5884] si above the line, with an insertion mark below.
5892] Meregazzi, p. 41.
5896] Rajna: francho for "stracho."
5898] Meregazzi Laisse XVI

5901] Rajna initially copies the second half of the next lineafter "como" here, the crosses it out and writes the correct ending above the cross-out. There is a white spot in the middle of the line (possibly water damage?).
5902] Rajna initially omits this line and then inserts in left margin.

5908] Cf. B 6215 Tornons a l’ovre ore material [Let’s turn back now to [our] subject]. Rohlfs, Morfologia, para. 530, speaks of second person plural literary forms in -n instead of -m, but in Tuscany.
5920] Meregazzi, p. 43
5923] Meregazzi Laisse XVII
5927] mia: i written above the line (Rajna)

5928] Rajna, Meregazzi: qu’el riavere folità; Cf. B 6235: Bien say de voir qu’i requier folité [I know for sure that what I seek is folly]; q is written above the line with no descender below the line.
5930] MS, Rajna: che fosse p[er] my fosse tristo. Here second "fosse" omitted.
5934] MS, Rajna: y questa
5935] Rajna: "eio" seems to have the first vowel crossed out.
5937] MS: nuy for "vuy"?
5942] Section of MS here removed.
5945] Meregazzi XVIII, p. 45. Rajna: tenebrossa
5949] Rajna: tenebre; B 6157 Qar le air troble et vient grant tenebror [For the air was shaken and great darkness came]; unusually, both have related words at line-end in the same laisse.
"zelura": B = jelor = gelo [cold]
MS (Rajna): et gran pianto; B 6268: E proie luy a larmes et a plor [And prayed to Him in tears and in lamentation]
Underlined text is here for the Latin (and almost Latin) quotes.
5966] Meregazzi: noble flame

5971] This section is confused in comparison to B 6279-6280: Fuir voloit, mes li franch pugnaor / L’oit refrené doucemant por amor [He wanted to flee, but the noble warrior / Held him back gently out of affection.]
5972] Meregazzi, p. 47.
5973] MS: y[n] lo .Re.; meaning of “y[n]” unclear here, emended out. Cf. B 6282: Si Diex non panse, la dovine douçor [If God, the Devine Sweetness, does not think [to help]
5975] Meregazzi Laisse XIX. Note that T has the indent in the following line, though this is clearly the beginning of a laisse by sense, and B begins laisse 243 with this line (there 6284).
5977] el = et + el
5978] The center of these lines (from 5978 to 5982) is damaged in the MS.
5980] Rajna: dio como eio sono...
5981] MS: avochato: the final -a- has an ink blot over it.
5983] Rajna: me ū preceded by what looks like a scratch out of the same; marginal note, "par n non M, non c'è ( sugon? ) molto e [con]trastare
5991] i written above the line between letters (correction/addition) both in MS and Rajna.
5993] Rajna: missing eio
5995] Reference to Aspremont.
5996] Rajna: Gustizia? Capital is difficult to interpret.
6001] Meregazzi, p. 49
6003] Laisse XX6003] Meregazzi Laisse XX
6006] Rajna: chazo promesso
6009] MS, Rajna: pene epene; Rajna writes (sic) after in his transcription.
6019] Meregazzi Laisse XXI
6022] Rajna: initial m in the left margin, note: “agg. st.e.” [aggiunto]
6024] MSI leardo, “che è di color grigio chiaro (un cavallo)” (GDLI vol. 8, p. 872, col. 1)
6026] Rajna omits this line, then re-inserts it in the right margin, with an indicator at the left side between the lines before and after it.
6027] Meregazzi, p. 51
6030] Meregazzi, [da] quelo che è..., emendation
6031] Meregazzi Laisse XXII
6034] MS: falso; cf. B 6348: Criant aloit por ses faons norir [Roaring as it went seeking food for its cubs]
6044] Rajna: fer followed by downstroke of “spa” from above; there is no connection with a following letter an does not appear to be a vowel after it (cf. end of line 6042, scrimire, above).

6046] Meregazzi: O[r]; Rajna, initial letter of line illegible, and B does not have an equivalent to the first hemistich (for the second hemistich, cf. B 6355: Le feri Uge, qui ert mestre dou scremir [Huon, a master of swordplay, smote it]
6054] Meregazzi Laisse XXIII, p. 53

6059] In the center of 7 lines is a distortion that makes reading most of the letters there difficult, and similarly on the facing page; it would appear to be from liquid removing the ink and distorting the page.
6064] This line and the following are reversed in Rajna's transcription; he corrects it by writing "2" then "1" in the left margin by the lines.
6076] = 91 (90) Rajna, 94 right
6079] Rajna, note: "o in e" for soave (letters underlined both in the note and his transcription)
6080] MS: ave; B 6389: Anunciabit gloriam de ton avent [Will proclaim the glory of your coming]
6083] Rajna: li bera. Correct to "li bero" = li baron; cf. B: li bier (l. 6392).
6084] Who? corr. l=afare in l=aferante

6087] MS: guarda l dedre; there is no caret mark for the insert above the line, but the page is slighted folded at this point. B: Sova[n]t soy garde e darer et davent, so the mark could have originally been the tironian note for "et"?
6088] Corr. pur presso in surpresso, Stengel. It's more likely porpreso, "seized."
6089] Stengel Keuschheitsprobe, (p 687), Stengel CCLIV
6092] Again here, for 6 lines, the center is problematic, it would seem to have been a liquid spread here between the two pages.
6097] Stengel: E luy; Rajna: apresio
6098] MS: sinave; Stengel: se'n avè
6099] Zingarelli, rist. 2018 della 12a ed.: quando che = veneto (p. 1843) = quando
6100] Stengel: semona
6101] Stengel: Un miracolo (l) ynn ora
6106] Stengel: semona
6107] Rajna: la via felona. The g above in lenguazo runs into the first letter, so it is unclear whether to read la or sa. I follow Rajna.

57462] The biblical account of Noah and his sons was greatly expanded during the middle ages. For a history of the developments, see Benjamin Braude, "The Sons of Noah and the Construction of Ethnic and Geographical Identities in the Medieval and Early Modern Periods," The William and Mary Quarterly, 3rd series, 54.1 (January 1997), pp. 103-142.
8321] Rajna: che cosa? (asay ne vite); difficult to read
8323] MS: morbade: written in smaller letters and "d" with a light slash in the ascender; "b" has "p" (?) written above.
8328] Rajna: r in l (molto)
8329] This line and the following are reversed in Rajna's transcription, corrected by his writing "2" and then "1" in the margin. “molto” was changed from “morto”.
8335] The descender in "p" of "parte" does have a line across it, but is not needed here as mark of abbreviation.

8350] Illumination follows; Rajna labels it "Ug e le formiche aurifere"; the entire center of the page is predominated by ants marching from left to right up a hill; the front half of Ugon’s horse is visible at the bottom center.
8361] Rajna: cosse for "coste"

8365] Square brackets in italicized section from Rajna. Note: "in marg. / mutily col /margin." Line inserted in the right margin over two lines, so end of each not visible, as he says, in the margin, mutilated with the margin.
8367] Once again the line that has been inserted (above, 8365) is almost identical to an already present line, this one.
10892] Rajna: agradise. This line and the following in the MS end in a rather rapidly dashed-off letter, but they do seem to -e.
10895] Rajna seems to write “afadighate” and then correct the “g”
10896] Rajna: line crossed out after luno
10897] Rajna: line crossed out before sa (seems to be an “f”)
10900] MS: zo is in the left margin, before the beginning of other lines. Rajna note: g[iunto]. st[esso]. i[nchiostro]. (for zo)
10901] Rajna: lenguazo
10908] çerte: there is a line here in the MS that seems to be a cedilla. Rajna gives a dash under the line.
10916] The handwriting size changes after this line, becoming much smaller though still the same style.
10917] MS: [crist]ianeta fede; this is the only time that form appears as an adjective, elsewhere (seven appearances) it is always a noun. For this reason we have emended.
10919] Rajna: fato; MS is not clear: it seems to be an –"o" with a line at the bottom, or perhaps formed in reverse (finishing at the bottom) by the scribe.
10928] Rajna: altre letre. The MS is burned at this edge here, but it looks like "atre letre," where only part of the first letter is visible. Thus the italics in the text.
10931] Pencil annotation in right margin, "Prete Gianni."

10937] MS: Yerosaleme (crossed-out "e" at the end of the line- slash going through it). Rajna: Ierosaleme. The form of the first letter is like his initials elsewhere, but is difficult to parse, it could be a “G”. The MS is clearly “ Y”.
10940] el gran mal: et el …
10942] Handwriting change at 169v: back to large print. There is a note in the right margin of the manuscript, "nuova.... grafia..."
Rajna: anchora
Graf, p. 109.
Graf: recevono; Rajna: benedizione .
Graf: si l'eno? .
Line not in Graf.
Graf: sauto.
Various editors cite these final lines, including also Peyron..
Peyron: oldite.

End of Rajna's transcription. The notebook, however, is not ended. It continues through a folio numbered 192. Folio 187 (back and front) is blank. Rajna describes L. I. 14 (Cod. 89) from 188-190; this is a resumé of Octavian. From folio 190V-192V, he speaks of Cod. xxvj =L. II.14 (?) of parchment sec. XIIIo o XIVo 586 folios in 2 columns, with a listing of contents, including Bovo d'Antona.
